means: 热得难受( swelter的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: We were sweltering at the beach.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们在沙滩上热得难受.

sentence.Network_en: The heat was sweltering, and the men grumbled fiercely over their work.
sentence.Network_cn: 天热得让人发昏, 水手们边干活边发着牢骚.

sentence.Network_en: Djakarta was a collection of sweltering huts and hovels.
sentence.Network_cn: 雅加达实际不过是一大堆闷热的棚户和茅舍.

entry.tran: 炎热的;酷热的;热得难受的
entry.def: If you describe the weather as sweltering, you mean that it is extremely hot and makes you feel uncomfortable.

means.word_mean: 1. excessively hot and humid or marked by sweating and faintness;
